YOUR VOICE OF AMERICA
"This is the Voice of America*89
These words and the programs they introduce have come to be identified
by radio listeners all over the globe with full and accurate news coverage,
a fair presentation of U*S* views, and hard-hitting analyses of Communist
actions and propaganda. For the people in countries under Communist domina¬
tion, VOA provides one of the few remaining links with the outside world and
a continuing source of hope and encouragement o For the free world, it brings
a closer understanding of the people and international policies of the United
States*
The Voice of America — a part of the UoS* Information Agency — is a
powerful instrument for international understanding * Its broadcasts, now
heard in 3U languages and dialects, total approximately 28 hours and 200,000
words a day* Its massage is projected to a global audience over a far-flung
network of about 80 stations* Its domestic transmitters are spotted across
the United States in the New York, Cincinnati, and San Francisco areas* More
than half of its transmitters are in distant locations — England, Mum,eh, Tangier
Salonika, Rhodes, Luzon Island in the Philippines, Okinawa, Honolulu, and
Ceylon* At some of these overseas locations, VOA programs are picked up by
very sensitive receivers and boosted in power by high-power short wave trans¬
mitters* At some of the stations, the programs are rebroadcast also on the
"standard broadcast band" which the simplest radio can pick up.
VOA’s million-watt transmitters commissioned in 19!?3S at Munich, Luzon,
and Okinawa are the most powerful known broadcasting stations in the world*
They are many times stronger than the largest commercial station in the
